body_html:
CUDA 10.0 support is coming soon in a released version of Tensorflow, see #22706 for more details.

On the other hand, it might not be officially supported by NVIDIA, but it is certainly possible to install CUDA 9.0 on Ubuntu 18.04 on certain systems. Here's proof from my system:

$ python -c 'import tensorflow as tf; print(tf.VERSION)'
1.11.0

$ python -c 'import tensorflow as tf; print(tf.sysconfig.get_lib() + "/python/_pywrap_tensorflow_internal.so")' | xargs ldd | grep libcu
	libcublas.so.9.0 => /usr/local/cuda-9.0/targets/x86_64-linux/lib/libcublas.so.9.0 (0x00007fa334ec5000)
	libcusolver.so.9.0 => /usr/local/cuda-9.0/targets/x86_64-linux/lib/libcusolver.so.9.0 (0x00007fa3302ca000)
	libcudart.so.9.0 => /usr/local/cuda-9.0/targets/x86_64-linux/lib/libcudart.so.9.0 (0x00007fa33005d000)
	libcuda.so.1 => /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libcuda.so.1 (0x00007fa32df33000)
	libcudnn.so.7 => /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libcudnn.so.7 (0x00007fa31bbfa000)
	libcufft.so.9.0 => /usr/local/cuda-9.0/targets/x86_64-linux/lib/libcufft.so.9.0 (0x00007fa313b59000)
	libcurand.so.9.0 => /usr/local/cuda-9.0/targets/x86_64-linux/lib/libcurand.so.9.0 (0x00007fa30fbf5000)

$ lsb_release -d
Description:	Ubuntu 18.04.1 LTS

CUDA 10.0 support is coming soon in a released version of Tensorflow, see #22706 for more details.
On the other hand, it might not be officially supported by NVIDIA, but it is certainly possible to install CUDA 9.0 on Ubuntu 18.04 on certain systems. Here's proof from my system:

body:
CUDA 10.0 support is coming soon in a released version of Tensorflow, see https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/22706 for more details.

On the other hand, it might not be officially supported by NVIDIA, but it is certainly possible to install CUDA 9.0 on Ubuntu 18.04 on certain systems. Here's proof from my system:
```
$ python -c 'import tensorflow as tf; print(tf.VERSION)'
1.11.0

$ python -c 'import tensorflow as tf; print(tf.sysconfig.get_lib() + "/python/_pywrap_tensorflow_internal.so")' | xargs ldd | grep libcu
	libcublas.so.9.0 => /usr/local/cuda-9.0/targets/x86_64-linux/lib/libcublas.so.9.0 (0x00007fa334ec5000)
	libcusolver.so.9.0 => /usr/local/cuda-9.0/targets/x86_64-linux/lib/libcusolver.so.9.0 (0x00007fa3302ca000)
	libcudart.so.9.0 => /usr/local/cuda-9.0/targets/x86_64-linux/lib/libcudart.so.9.0 (0x00007fa33005d000)
	libcuda.so.1 => /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libcuda.so.1 (0x00007fa32df33000)
	libcudnn.so.7 => /usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libcudnn.so.7 (0x00007fa31bbfa000)
	libcufft.so.9.0 => /usr/local/cuda-9.0/targets/x86_64-linux/lib/libcufft.so.9.0 (0x00007fa313b59000)
	libcurand.so.9.0 => /usr/local/cuda-9.0/targets/x86_64-linux/lib/libcurand.so.9.0 (0x00007fa30fbf5000)

$ lsb_release -d
Description:	Ubuntu 18.04.1 LTS
```
